alert.note: Alert for Holmes; Wayne (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 8:18PM EST until March 11 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Cleveland OH has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio... Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck affecting Holmes and Wayne Counties. For the Killbuck Creek...including Killbuck...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Private property on Water Street in the Village of Killbuck flooded. Several county and local roads impassable including State Route 60 south and County Road 621. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Sunday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 16.7 feet Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.7 feet on 06/09/1981. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning by 615 AM EST.
